diff_hunk:
@@ -2939,8 +2939,9 @@
         kwarg_only: True
       - THTensor* mat1
       - THTensor* mat2
-    - cname: spaddmm
-      sparse: yes
+    - sparse: True
body:
Okay it turns out that `sparse=True` does something else: it tells the parser to prepend `THS` or `THCS` to the `cname`. Options declared with `aten_sparse` do this automatically but `aten_dense_sparse` doesn't.

At any rate, I'll change the searching in my code to search for `aten_dense_sparse` instead of `sparse=True` and keep `sparse=True` in the cwrap.
body_html:
Okay it turns out that sparse=True does something else: it tells the parser to prepend THS or THCS to the cname. Options declared with aten_sparse do this automatically but aten_dense_sparse doesn't.

At any rate, I'll change the searching in my code to search for aten_dense_sparse instead of sparse=True and keep sparse=True in the cwrap.
body_text:
Okay it turns out that sparse=True does something else: it tells the parser to prepend THS or THCS to the cname. Options declared with aten_sparse do this automatically but aten_dense_sparse doesn't.
At any rate, I'll change the searching in my code to search for aten_dense_sparse instead of sparse=True and keep sparse=True in the cwrap.
